transcript: because the average gym owner takes down 36 000 a year in personal income I had 17 different people who work for me try to start their version of my business you were bankrupt on the brink of divorce and you used all the stuff you scaled to three locations and sold them and now your family's financially set off and like now you want to attack me like I think now I can handle it a lot better but at the time I just like I felt so disenfranchised I just felt hurt honestly because I really poured my soul into trying to fix the gym industry when I felt that way we created space and then it just became an asset we owned and that's why I was open to selling it
